content: Great! Thank you for being here today. How are you doing? What would you like to talk about?

Honestly, I’m not doing great. Things at home are falling apart—my son is acting out and I feel like I have no idea how to help him. It’s putting so much strain on my marriage, and I’m worried we’re heading for the end. Everything feels heavy, and I’m just here because my wife insisted.

That sounds like a lot to carry. You're trying to navigate challenges with your son, the pressure that's putting on your marriage, and the weight of it all feels overwhelming. It’s understandable you'd be feeling this way given everything going on. Where do you think you’d like to start in sorting through what’s on your mind?
I guess maybe starting with my son. It feels like the rest of my life is falling apart because of how lost I feel trying to help him. I don’t even know where to begin, though.

It sounds like you're really concerned about your son, and it’s been difficult not knowing how best to help him. It also seems like his challenges are affecting so many other parts of your life. What do you think is the biggest struggle you’re noticing with him right now?

Right now, he’s been so angry and defiant all the time—it feels like he’s shutting us out completely. He’s acting out at school too, and it’s like we’re constantly being called in for something. We’ve tried talking to him, setting boundaries, but nothing seems to work, and it makes me feel completely powerless.

That sounds like such a tough situation—trying so hard to reach out to him, setting limits, and still feeling like nothing is making a difference. It must be so frustrating and draining to feel like no matter what you do, you’re not breaking through. When you think about what’s been going on for him, do you have any ideas about what might be behind his anger or defiance?

Honestly, I’m not sure. It could be something at school, maybe something he’s not telling us, or maybe it’s even something we’re doing wrong as parents. I’ve tried asking him, but he just pushes me away or gets upset. It’s hard not knowing what’s causing it.

Not knowing why he’s struggling must make it even tougher, especially when you’re trying so hard to connect and understand. It sounds like you really care about his well-being and want to figure this out. What do you think makes it hard for him to open up when you try to talk to him?
